title: 110_hr4840
content:
The "S Corporation Modernization Act of 2007" is referenced in this section, which reduces the recognition period for built-in gains. The recognition period for built-in gains in S corporations is defined as a 7-year period starting from the first taxable year as an S corporation. The amendment applies to determining the recognition period for specific taxable years under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment to section 1374(d)(7) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 applies to built-in gains in S corporations occurring before, on, or after the enactment date, but does not apply for determining the tax imposed by section 1374 for taxable years ending before that date. SEC. 3. EXPANSION OF QUALIFYING BENEFICIARIES OF AN ELECTING SMALL BUSINESS TRUST. Amends section 1361(c)(2)(B) to exclude clause (v) for eligibility purposes under subsection (b)(1)(C). Effective on enactment date.

SEC. 4. REPEAL OF EXCESSIVE PASSIVE INVESTMENT INCOME AS A TERMINATION EVENT. SEC. 4. REPEAL OF EXCESSIVE PASSIVE INVESTMENT INCOME AS A TERMINATION EVENT. Amends section 1362(d) by removing paragraph (3) and makes related conforming amendments. Effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2007. The tax imposed on passive investment income of corporations with accumulated earnings and profits exceeding 25 percent of gross receipts is increased to 60 percent. Various sections and headings are amended to reflect this change. The tax on passive investment income for corporations with accumulated earnings and profits exceeding 25 percent of gross receipts is raised to 60 percent, effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2007. Expansion of S Corporation eligible shareholders to include IRAs. Expansion of S Corporation eligible shareholders to include IRAs. Amendments allow trusts constituting individual retirement accounts to hold stock in S Corporations and exempt the sale of such stock to the account holder from prohibited transaction rules. The amendments allow trusts, including IRAs, to hold stock in S Corporations. The sale of such stock to the account holder is exempt from prohibited transaction rules if certain conditions are met, including fair market value sale within 120 days of S corporation election. The effective date of these amendments is the date of enactment of the Act. SEC. 7 allows small business trusts to deduct charitable contributions without regard to certain limitations. The amendment applies to taxable years after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 8 calls for a study on entity neutrality. SEC. 8 calls for a study on entity neutrality under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, comparing treatment between S corporations and limited liability companies, identifying differences in pass-through entity rules, and exploring why entities may prefer one set of rules over another.
